content: David Bowie was inspired to pursue a music career by a combination of factors including his love for rock and roll music, the Beatles, and his interest in theater and performance art. Bowie also found inspiration in the art and fashion scenes of the 1960s, particularly the Mod and Carnaby Street fashion movements. Additionally, he began experimenting with different musical styles and studied various art forms, which helped him to develop his unique style and creative vision.
